tool.name: Meryl
tool.command:
export GALAXY_MEMORY_GB=\$((\${GALAXY_MEMORY_MB:-8192}/1024)) && #if $options_kmer_size.kmer_size == 'estimate' #from math import log #set size=int(log(int($options_kmer_size.genome_size)*(1-float($options_kmer_size.collision_rate))/float($options_kmer_size.collision_rate))/log(4)) #elif $options_kmer_size.kmer_size == 'provide' #set size=$options_kmer_size.input_kmer_size #end if ln -s '$input_reads' ./input.${input_reads.ext} &&
meryl $count_operation k=$size memory=\$GALAXY_MEMORY_GB threads=\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} ./input.${input_reads.ext} output read-db.meryl && echo 'K-mer size: ${size}' && tar -cf read-db.meryldb --use-compress-program="pigz -p \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1}" read-db.meryl

param.name: count_operation
param.label: Count operations
param.help: Select an operation to be executed
param.option: Count: count the occurrences of canonical k-mers
Count-forward: count the occurreces of forward k-mers
Count-reverse: count the occurreces of reverse k-mers

param.name: input_reads
param.label: Input sequences
param.help: Select your reads in FASTA/FASTQ format.

param.name: input_kmer_size
param.label: K-mer size
param.help: For a human genome, the best k-mer size is k=21 for both haploid (3.1G) or diploid (6.2G)..

param.name: genome_size
param.label: Genome size
param.help: Haploid genome size or diploid genome size, depending on what we evaluate. In bp. Only required if the k-mer size is not provided.

param.name: collision_rate
param.label: Tolerable collision rate
param.help: Tolerable collision rate. By default is 0.001.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Purpose**
Meryl is the k-mer counter. This tool can be used to count kmers.
- Count: count the occurrences of canonical k-mers - Count-forward: count the occurreces of forward k-mers - Count-reverse: count the occurreces of reverse k-mers
